result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward Earl Roby Jr.

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed. Defense Substitution of Judge Request

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Van Grunsven.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Grayson, Br. 16.

Defendant Edward Earl Roby Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii appeared by video for Edward Earl Roby Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Edward Earl Roby Jr. appeared by video, in custody in MSDF.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Status Conference. Defense Counsel in a Plea/Sentencing and unable to appear. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Edward Earl Roby in court by video, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Edward Earl Roby in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Edward Earl Roby in custody at MSDF.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Edward Earl Roby appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Van Grunsven, Branch 09. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Edward Earl Roby Jr.
Current: 4557 N 49TH Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218   (Effective: 08-08-2022)
Prior: 7901 West Palmetto Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53218
